meanings.definition: Showing or having a lack of courage or determination
meanings.sent1: She was the sissiest one in the class, always afraid to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The kitten looked sissiest when faced with the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent3: Even the brave knight felt a bit sissiest when he saw the dragon up close.
meanings.sent4: His sissiest behavior made him blend into the background like a ghost.
meanings.sent5: The storm's loud thunder made her feel sissiest and small.

meanings.definition: The most timid or cowardly person in a group
meanings.sent1: He was known as the sissiest in the team, always backing out of challenges.
meanings.sent2: The little boy was the sissiest in the group, often seeking comfort from others.
meanings.sent3: The sissiest of them all, the puppy would hide at the sound of a doorbell.
meanings.sent4: The sissiest of the group, she avoided any situation that seemed even slightly risky.
meanings.sent5: In the forest, the deer was the sissiest, always running away at the slightest noise.
